author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
Textiles Commissioner Kavita Gupta said that the Ministry wish to have a natural growth of apparels produced from man-made fibres in the country in spite of the rising global demand for the man-made fibres.

Global scenario

“At present, almost 60 per cent of the apparels from the country are still made from cotton and only 40 per cent from man-made fibres. In the global scenario, the ratio is exactly the reverse. However, we think that there is no need to overcome the disparity for the mere reason that cotton is also an important natural fibre on which lots of employment, livelihood and agriculture is dependent,” she told The Hindu here on Thursday.

According to her, the Ministry has now been giving focus to improve the domestic production of technical textiles as an ‘import substitution’ by coming out with value-added products through research. “We are already in the process of developing prototypes and medical textiles meant for artificial implants, among others,” the Textile Commissioner said.

New facilities

On the day, Union Minister of State for Textiles Santosh Kumar Gangwar inaugurated workers’ hostel and a building for an industrial unit.

He also laid the foundation for buildings for two more industrial units, all on the premises of Palladam Hi-Tech Weaving Park.

The total expenditure for the projects was Rs. 34 crore, with Rs. 13 crore coming as government grant under different schemes.
title: ‘Production of technical textiles should improve’
